cocoa_black_pod.name: Cocoa Black Pod Disease
cocoa_black_pod.description: Fungal disease caused by Phytophthora species. Appears as dark brown to black lesions on cocoa pods. Most severe during rainy season.
cocoa_black_pod.treatment:
1. Remove and destroy all infected pods immediately
2. Apply copper-based fungicide (e.g., Kocide) every 2 weeks during rainy season
3. Improve farm drainage to reduce moisture
4. Harvest ripe pods promptly
cocoa_black_pod.prevention: Regular pruning for air circulation, maintain 3m spacing between trees, remove pod husks from farm, timely harvesting
recommendations: Spray fungicide early morning or late evening

cassava_mosaic.name: Cassava Mosaic Virus
cassava_mosaic.description: Viral disease transmitted by whiteflies. Causes yellow and white mosaic patterns on leaves, leaf distortion, and stunted growth.
cassava_mosaic.treatment:
1. No cure available - remove infected plants immediately
2. Burn or bury removed plants far from field
3. Use virus-free planting material from certified sources
4. Control whitefly population with neem-based sprays
cassava_mosaic.prevention: Plant resistant varieties (e.g., TMS varieties), use certified disease-free stems, maintain 1m x 1m spacing, remove infected plants within 2 weeks of planting
recommendations: Rogue out infected plants every 2 weeks
Plant during dry season to reduce whitefly activity

maize_streak.name: Maize Streak Virus
maize_streak.description: Viral disease transmitted by leafhoppers. Causes pale yellow streaks parallel to leaf veins. Can cause 100% yield loss if infection occurs early.
maize_streak.treatment:
1. No cure - focus on prevention
2. Remove severely infected plants
3. Plant maize early in season
4. Use resistant varieties
maize_streak.prevention: Early planting (start of rains), use resistant varieties, control leafhopper vectors, maintain field hygiene
recommendations: Plant within first 2 weeks of rainy season

banana_sigatoka.name: Black Sigatoka
banana_sigatoka.description: Fungal leaf spot disease of banana and plantain. Starts as small brown spots, enlarges to black streaks with yellow halo. Reduces photosynthesis.
banana_sigatoka.treatment:
1. Remove affected leaves (sanitize tools between plants)
2. Apply systemic fungicide (e.g., Propiconazole)
3. Improve drainage and air circulation
4. Apply mulch to prevent soil splash
banana_sigatoka.prevention: Plant resistant varieties, wide spacing (3m x 3m), remove old leaves regularly, improve drainage
recommendations: Alternate fungicide types to avoid resistance

tomato_blight.name: Tomato Late Blight
tomato_blight.description: Fungal disease causing dark water-soaked lesions on leaves, stems, and fruits. Can destroy entire crop in days during cool wet weather.
tomato_blight.treatment:
1. Apply copper-based fungicide immediately
2. Remove all infected plant parts
3. Improve air circulation by staking plants
4. Reduce overhead irrigation
tomato_blight.prevention: Use resistant varieties, avoid overhead watering, stake plants for air flow, apply preventive fungicide sprays
recommendations: Start fungicide sprays before symptoms appear in wet season
Rotate crops - don't plant tomatoes in same spot annually

coffee_rust.name: Coffee Leaf Rust
coffee_rust.description: Fungal disease causing orange-yellow powdery spots on undersides of coffee leaves. Leads to premature leaf drop and reduced yields.
coffee_rust.treatment:
1. Apply copper-based fungicide when disease first appears
2. Remove heavily infected leaves
3. Improve farm shade management (30-40% shade)
4. Apply balanced fertilizer to strengthen plants
coffee_rust.prevention: Plant rust-resistant varieties, maintain optimal shade, prune for air circulation, apply preventive fungicide
recommendations: Apply fungicide every 3 weeks during rainy season

healthy.name: Healthy Plant
healthy.description: No disease symptoms detected. Plant appears healthy with normal leaf color and structure.
healthy.treatment: No treatment needed. Continue regular maintenance and monitoring.
healthy.prevention: Maintain good agricultural practices: balanced fertilization, proper spacing, regular weeding, pest monitoring
recommendations: Continue regular monitoring for early disease detection
Maintain soil health with organic matter
